narratives.description:
The senior information technology (IT) manager is a vital part of any organization that utilizes technology in the work place. This position is usually filled by a leader as the senior IT manager is usually in charge of a group of employees in the field. Employees in this position are responsible for working with computer and technological problems in offices, and are expected to keep the technological aspect and tools of the company running smoothly so that employees in different areas can do their jobs as efficiently as possible.
Most employers will look for somebody who is familiar with the technology used in their workplace. Senior IT managers need to know how to operate most of the programs that the organization uses. They must also be very good problem solvers, as the job consists of a lot of fixing and solving of technology-related problems. 
Because it is a management position, the senior IT manager should be able to keep a team focused and motivated. This position works with other members of the IT department, so communication skills are a must. This position can be an office position or a traveling position depending on the employer. Usually, an employer will ask for a bachelor's degree in a related field (such as computer science). As stated before, a potential employee in this position would typically need to have experience and skill with computers and other technologies. Some employers may give a competency exam with an interview. 
A 9-5 shift is not uncommon for senior IT managers, although some employers may prefer that the IT department do their work after normal office hours. The employer's expectations and demands for the IT department can change drastically, depending on the type of company. However, a senior IT manager should generally expect to mostly deal with the upkeep of the networks and computer system.
narratives.summaryHourly: The average pay for a Senior Information Technology (IT) Manager is $42.47 per hour.
narratives.summarySalary: The average pay for a Senior Information Technology (IT) Manager is $127,050 per year.

tasks: Establish IT policies regarding operational procedures and ensure compliance.
Work with outside vendors, upper management, and leadership of other departments to ensure smooth processes.
Establish strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning.
Plan and schedule project guidelines and goals while ensuring timelines are met.

occupationalDetails.skills: People Management, Leadership, IT Management, Project Management, Information Technology (IT) Support, IT Security & Infrastructure, Operations Management, Software Architecture, Strategic Planning, Cisco Networking, Budget Management, SQL, Microsoft SQL Server, Windows Server 2012 R2, Network Management / Administration, Team Management, VoIP, Strategic Project Management, System Administration, Software Development, Enterprise Application Integration, e-Commerce, Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL), Agile Software Development, Program Management, Microsoft Exchange, Cyber Security, Wireless Data Communications, Middleware, Systems Engineering, Security Risk Management, EDI, Linux, Innovation, IT Consulting, Product Management, VMware ESX, Windows NT / 2000 / XP Networking, Business Analysis, Process Improvement, Windows Operating System General Use, Vendor Management, Enterprise Solutions, Portfolio Management, Product Development, Network Architecture / Design, Risk Management / Risk Control, Microsoft Active Directory, Microsoft Office, Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Amazon Web Services (AWS), Business Intelligence, SAP Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Strategy, UNIX, Software Development LifeCycle (SDLC), Storage Area Networking (SAN), Network Security Management, Internet Information Server (IIS)
